title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts and Bucks - BBC News
summary: millions to be spent on new missile systems .
'complex ' investigation continues into cheshunt care home fire .
pupils march in protest against rubbish .
charge to see hertfordshire bluebells returns .
goalkeeper david martin to leave mk dons .

documents.title: skipping world record attempt hailed a success
text: earlier we brought you a story that peter thompson , from bedfordshire , was aiming to skip his way into the record books by carrying out the most crossovers in one minute .
well we 've just been told he managed 112 , which is 13 more than the current world record .
it now just needs to be verified by the guinness world records .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lawro 's predictions v jermaine jenas and trevor nelson
text: lawro 's predictions v jermaine jenas and trevor nelson

documents.title: hull city 2-0 watford
text: hull city 2-0 watford
author: Jamie Strickland
BBC Sport

documents.title: men arrested over nightclub acid attack
text: men arrested over nightclub acid attack

documents.title: goodbye for now
text: that 's it for today .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .
have a good weekend .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teacher completes 28-mile walk to school
text: a head teacher has completed her 28-mile walk from her home in rugby to brackley junior school .
promoting the healthy schools project , ros peet set off at 04:30 and made it to school at about 15:00 .
ros peet said : `` my children were waiting at the gate with a lovely reception singing one more step along the world i go .
`` when i got to helmdom , which is about four miles from school , my feet started hurting and i did wonder if i 'd get there . ''
she 's raised about £ 800 the school fund .

documents.title: teenager denies brother 's murder
text: a teenager has denied murdering his brother .
brandon lavender , 18 , of brompton close , aylesbury , buckinghamshire , is accused of stabbing daniel lavender , 26 , on 16 january .
he was taken to hospital but died later .
the accused appeared at reading crown court earlier , and denied murder .
he is expected to face a trial at the same court on 12 june .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cloudy with bright spells and much cooler
text: a largely cloudy night with some patchy light rain pushing down from the north .
the winds becoming light and variable and lowest temperatures around 6c ( 43f ) .
once the last of any overnight rain has cleared , saturday will be relatively cloudy with odd showers feeding southwards .
there should be some bright or sunny spells and a top temperature of 13c ( 55f ) .
a cold start to sunday with a touch of frost in places , it 'll then be largely dry with some brightness and sunshine at times and the small chance of a shower .
temperatures again reaching around 13c ( 55f ) at best .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: millions coming to a & e hospitals
text: the government has allocated about £ 3.5m to hospitals in beds , bucks and herts to help them deal with winter pressures in accident and emergency departments .
the announcement was made in the budget , but where the money is being sent has only just been released .
here 's a breakdown of who 's getting what :
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: breakingthatched cottage on fire
text: fire crews are dealing with a `` significant '' blaze at a thatched cottage in easton maudit , between wellingborough and olney .
more details to follow

documents.title: warburtons factory could close in milton keynes
text: the bakery giant warburtons has announced it 's planning to close its factory in milton keynes , putting 218 jobs at risk .
the firm , based at the giles bakery on the blakelands industrial site , has been run by warburtons since a take-over in 2013 , and makes a range of products including garlic bread .
in a statement , warburtons said : `` after much consideration we have made the extremely difficult decision to enter into a period of consultation .
`` this proposal is a result of significant ongoing challenges facing the business and is despite considerable time and financial investment . ''
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: school children help clean up mk rubbish
text: pupils from schools in milton keynes have already started to do their bit to improve their community , by carrying out litter
mk schoolchildren 's campaign to clean up the town 's # redways .
today 300 pupils marched to @ twitterid calling for action @ twitterid
technically , the council is exploiting children s tax payer 's pay for council to have their teams doing this .
what about sharps ?
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: man killed in van crash
text: a man has died after a white van he was in crashed near brackley .
northamptonshire police said a renault trafic lost control `` for reasons unknown '' at the duck end junction in hinton-in-the-hedges , at about 12:30 , and rolled on to its side .
three people were in the van , which was the only vehicle involved in the crash .
police said they were still informing next-of-kin .

documents.title: pupils march in protest against rubbish
text: hundreds of children from six schools in milton keynes have marched to the council 's offices this afternoon , calling for improvements to be made to the town 's redways .
the pupils have come together to show that they are unhappy about the amount of rubbish that 's being dumped on the cycleways and footpaths , and want to help clear it up .
they 're asking milton keynes council to support new litter patrols , improve lighting and cut back hedges .
we 've asked the council to comment .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: have you ever wondered how you can become a candidate in the election ?
text: if theresa may 's recent announcement of a snap election in june has made you yearn to be an mp , here are a few guidelines for you to consider .
you ca n't stand if you 're :
if none of those conditions preclude you , and you 're either a british citizen , a citizen of the .
republic of ireland or a commonwealth country ( with certain provisos ) then you 're over the first hurdle , and will need to consider these regulations :
there - it 's almost as simple as that .
so what 's stopping you ?
i 'm off now to see how much money is in my piggy bank .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: anti-speeding device 'stolen from village '
text: thieves have stolen a speed monitoring device which was placed in a village to remind motorists of the 30mph limit , police say .
it was installed by highways england on deanshanger road in wicken , near milton keynes .
when officials went to check it last week , only the mounting bracket was left on the post , northamptonshire police said .
it is thought to have been taken some time between 9 and 11 march .

documents.title: arrests made in hackney club acid attack
text: police investigating the acid attack in a nightclub in hackney have arrested a man in north london .
arthur collins ( 25 , from broxbourne in hertfordshire , is still being sought by police .
a 33-year-old woman from hertfordshire arrested on sus of firearms offences yesterday has been released on bail .
officers have also searched addresses in milton keynes .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: dunstable theatre celebrates 10th birthday
text: the grove theatre in dunstable is celebrating its 10th birthday
the @ twitterid in # dunstable is 10 years old.. join the celebrations today by visiting

documents.title: teen 's software 'behind more than one million cyber attacks '
text: the old bailey has today heard how a hertfordshire teenager created the software behind more than 1.7 million cyber attacks on websites around the world .
adam mudd , who 's now 19 , from kings langley , has already pleaded guilty to three charges of creating the malware and selling it to other people .
the hearing was told he built the `` titanium stresser '' tool on a computer in his bedroom , when he was just 15 .
today , the prosecution described how the software was used to attack the servers of cambridge university , sony playstation and xbox .
one company , runescape , had to spend £ 6m protecting itself against such attacks and lost more than £ 180,000 in revenue , the court heard .
mudd is said to have made £ 386,000 from the software .
he is due to be sentenced on tuesday .
author: Angus Crawford
BBC News correspondent

documents.title: 'complex ' investigation continues into cheshunt care home fire
text: investigations could continue for `` some time '' to find out the cause of a fire that ripped through a cheshunt care home , killing two women .
ivy spriggs , aged 91 , and 88-year-old daphne holloway died in the fire at newgrange care home on 8 april .

darryl keen , chief fire officer of hertfordshire fire service , said : `` the extent of the damage and the fierceness of the fire mean this is a complex investigation and it may be some time before we can confirm how and why it started . ''

he confirmed they 're currently working with the police , health and safety executive and care quality commission `` to examine how the fire started and spread , and what lessons , if any , can be learned to prevent similar tragedies in future '' .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: charge to see hertfordshire bluebells returns
text: for the first time last year , the national trust charged people to visit the bluebells at the popular ashridge estate in hertfordshire .
well , the fees are returning this year .
on 29 , 30 april and 1 , 6 and 7 may , adults will have to pay £ 3 and children £ 1 to see the flowers in dockey wood .
lawrence trowbridge , the lead ranger at ashridge estate , said the charges were introduced to keep visitor numbers down and the £ 8,000 raised last year has been spent on `` conservation work '' .
he added that some people were `` disappointed '' with the fees , but `` it 's an effective means of calming the pressure down '' when so many people descend on the area at peak times .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'what a trivia question i could be '
text: 'what a trivia question i could be '

documents.title: 50 mps urge government support for crossrail 2
text: more than 50 mps have signed a letter to the chancellor and transport secretary urging them to support crossrail 2 .
the proposed train line would serve stations across london , linking surrey in the south with hertfordshire in the north via an underground tunnel .
the mps say it would have a huge positive impact on the economy , jobs and homes .
transport for london said it would like to see all political parties include crossrail 2 in their manifestos .
the department for transport says that the next government will need to consider the business case carefully , after the general election .

documents.title: man stabbed and robbed in bedford
text: a man had his face slashed as he was attacked by a group of men in a block of flats on muswell road in bedford , police have said .
bedfordshire police has only just released the information about the incident , which happened between 16:20 and 16:40 on 12 april .
it says three or four men stabbed him in the face and stole money from him .
the men are described as black and were wearing balaclavas .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: would £ 539m missile money be better spent on health care ?
text: today i met the defence secretary sir michael fallon , after he announced more than £ 500m would be spent on `` vital '' missile systems at mbda , which is based in stevenage .
i asked him if the money would have been better invested in the nhs or social care ?
he said : `` the first duty of any government is to keep our people safe , that means we have to invest in defence , invest in our armed forces and invest in the royal navy .

`` these contracts today are an investment in the latest missiles and missiles systems that will keep our ships , our frigates , destroyers and aircraft carriers safe , just as they keep the people of this country safe . ''
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: weather prospects for sunday 's marathon
text: joining the starting line for sunday 's london marathon ?
cheering on friends or family ?
the forecast is here .
lm
look for the 6 marathons in 6 days tomorrow on number 6 !
should n't meteogroup have took over by now ?

documents.title: jump to it !
text: when i was young ( sadly too long ago ) no playground was complete without a large number of girls skipping in the break times .
i think i could do just a few jumps , but one bedfordshire man can do many more !
peter thompson will today attempt to break the world record for the most number of crossovers performed with a skipping rope in 60 seconds .
he 's due to attempt the record at 12:00 at the empire nightclub in bedford , on , of course national skipping day .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missile investment will 'secure hundreds of high-skilled jobs '
text: the £ 539m announced today by the government will be spent on three new missile contracts at mbda stevenage .

the government says the deal will `` ensure our armed forces have the best equipment available to protect the new queen elizabeth class carriers and the extended fleet from current and future threats '' .
dave armstrong , managing director of mbda uk , said he was `` delighted '' with the news .
he added that it would provide the armed forces with `` new cutting-edge capabilities and ensuring their current systems remain relevant for the future .
`` they will also help to secure hundreds of high-skilled people at mbda uk and in the uk supply chain . ''
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: two arrested in illegal dumping probe
text: two arrested in illegal dumping probe

documents.title: missile investment is a 'testament to your skills '
text: this is the moment that sir michael fallon made the multi-million pound announcement at mbda in stevenage .
defence secretary sir michael fallon at # mbda # stevenage to announce £ 539m investment in new missile systems @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: millions to be spent on new missile systems
text: the government has announced a £ 539m investment in new missile systems that should protect jobs at sites in hertfordshire and bedfordshire .
the defence secretary sir michael fallon made the announcement at mbda in stevenage this morning .
the money should sustain 130 jobs at the company 's four sites in the uk , including stevenage , and henlow in bedfordshire .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: teacher taking 30 mile trek in to school to encourage benefits of a healthy lifestyle
text: were you thinking of walking in to work today , but decided you did n't have the energy ?
well , it 's time to hang your head in shame and pay tribute to brackley head teacher rosalyne peet .
she 's currently taking a very long walk in to school today - more than 30 miles .
the idea is to encourage her pupils to adopt a more healthy lifestyle .
let 's hope she makes it in time for registration

documents.title: goalkeeper david martin to leave mk dons
text: mk dons have announced goalkeeper david martin will leave the club at the end of the season .
the 31-year-old has made more than 330 appearances in two spells , but says it 's time to pursue a new challenge .
he said : `` we have our last home game of the season on saturday and it will be my chance to say farewell to our amazing fans . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: the closest play-off race ever ?
text: the closest play-off race ever ?
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: sir michael fallon to visit stevenage missile company
text: the defence secretary sir michael fallon is set to make a speech in stevenage this morning .
he will be at missile company mbda in six hills way .

documents.title: friday 's weather : pleasantly warm when the sun breaks through
text: today 's likely to be the warmest day of the week , although it will be rather cloudy .
we 're into warmer air now , so it should feel pleasantly warm in any sunshine that appears .
the cloud will gradually thin and break during the morning , and that will really help to lift the temperatures , giving us highs of about 15c ( 59f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome back to our live feed for bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , weather and travel from across the three counties from now until 18:00 .
first up , we 'll bring you a full regional weather forecast .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: goalkeeper martin to leave mk dons
text: goalkeeper martin to leave mk dons

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , weather , travel and sport updates - but any breaking news will be posted here overnight .
have a lovely evening .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: men jailed for using drones to deliver drugs to prisons
text: two men who flew drugs and mobile phones into a prison in hertfordshire using drones have been jailed .
police say remo white-channer ( left ) and romaine gayle ( right ) were part of an organised crime group smuggling contraband into several prisons .
the two 24-year-olds bought drones costing £ 1,000 each and put together packages of cannabis , s heroin and phones .
they flew them into the mount prison in bovingdon , near hemel hempstead , and jails in kent and suffolk .
it is estimated that the total value of the contraband white-channer and gayle flew in to all three prisons is around £ 48,000 .
the scam was uncovered when one of the drones crash landed on the roof of the mount .
both men pleaded guilty to using drones to deliver significant amounts of class a and class b drugs , as well as mobile phones .
white-channer , 24 , of carisbrooke road , mitcham , surrey , was sentenced to six-and-a-half years in jail .
gayle , who 's in prison for another offence , was sentenced to four years and four months .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up
text: let 's have a look at what some of our local newspapers are reporting today :
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp calls for reassurance over post-brexit hs2 work
text: a buckinghamshire mp is calling on the government to make sure the building of hs2 wo n't harm the environment once eu regulations expire after brexit .
cheryl gillan , the conservative mp for chesham and amersham , raised her concerns in the commons .
`` can the minister ensure that our exiting of the european union does n't hand a blank cheque to hs2 to ride roughshod through our country side ? ''
she said .
the environment minister therese coffey insisted the countryside would be protected .
`` the government has always committed that in developing hs2 we will uphold the highest environmental standards that we cherish , '' she said .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: football manager 's charity skydive
text: football manager 's charity skydive

documents.title: 'it 's colder than arctic winter up here '
text: 'it 's colder than arctic winter up here '

documents.title: john mcdonnell in luton
text: shadow chancellor john mcdonnell has been on the campaign trail in luton today .
alongside luton north mp kelvin hopkins , mr mcdonnell ( right ) was spreading the word of the labour party ahead of the snap general election in june .

documents.title: fujitsu staff on strike
text: workers at the fujitsu site in stevenage are joining strike action by the unite union today in the first of a series of 48-hour protests .
the dispute at the it company centres on pay , pensions , job security and union recognition .
tomorrow a letter is being handed in to japan 's ambassador to the uk , asking him to intervene in the current dispute , which the union says could see 1,800 job losses .
fujitsu declined to comment on the strike action .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: afternoon weather : cloudy with some rain
text: the skies will become cloudier than of late this afternoon .
at times , the cloud could be thick enough for the odd spot of rain .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
for the full forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: nightclub acid attack : arrest made in hertfordshire
text: detectives investigating an acid attack in a london nightclub have carried out three arrest warrants at addresses in hertfordshire .
a 33-year-old woman was arrested at one of the addresses this morning on sus of firearms offences and remains in custody .
detectives are continuing to appeal for information on the whereabouts of 25-year-old arthur collins , from hertfordshire , who is wanted for questioning by police .
the girlfriend of mr collins , tv personality ferne mccann , has urged him to go to a police station immediately .
officers were called to the nightclub , on sidworth street in dalston , at approximately 01:10 on monday after members of the public complained of a noxious substance .
two men , aged 24 and 29 , have been transferred to a specialist burns hospital in essex , where they remain in a serious but stable condition .
a 22-year-old woman who suffered burns to her face has been left blinded in her left eye .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prison officer appears in court over inmate death
text: a senior prison officer from woodhill prison in milton keynes has appeared in court , charged with gross negligence , manslaughter and misconduct in public office after the death of a prisoner .
joseph travers , 55 , of milton keynes , did not enter a plea and now faces trial at the old bailey in connection with the death of inmate ryan harvey .
mr harvey , 23 , was found hanged in his cell at woodhill in may 2015 .
he was one of five prisoners found hanging in their cells in hmp woodhill in 2015 .
the prison had the worst record for suspected suicides in england and wales that year .
mr travers will next appear at the old bailey on 18 may .

documents.title: man charged over roadside rape
text: man charged over roadside rape

documents.title: police recruit volunteer riders in fight against illegal bikers
text: the police campaign against illegal off-road motor bikes in bedfordshire has been boosted by volunteer officers .
since january 2016 , operation meteor has seen 56 bikes seized and 12 people arrested .
eight specials have now joined the team which aims to tackle dangerous riding in public spaces .
four of the volunteer officers have already passed an off-road motorbike course , while a further four will complete the training soon .
insp annita clarke says the specials will provide key support in the fight against illegal bikers .
`` these are people within the special constabulary who are already motorcycle riders , and they 've been specially trained to deal with off-road cycling , '' she said .
`` they 're qualified to ride off road in a way that is professional , ethical and completely represents bedfordshire police . ''

documents.title: funeral of milton keynes murder victim held today
text: the funeral takes place this afternoon of the milton keynes woman who died from the injuries she sustained during a burglary at her home in january .
hang yin leung died 11 days after being knocked over and held down when a group of six men forced entry to her home and stole cash , jewellery and her hong kong police long service medal .
thames valley police is carrying out a murder investigation into the death of the 64-year-old but no-one has been charged .
mrs leung 's son keith says the funeral will be a traditional service .
`` mum was quite christian and dad wanted to respect her beliefs , so it will be quite a traditional christian memorial service followed by cremation , '' he said .
he added the funeral would be a chance for family members to come to terms with his mother 's death .
`` it 's less about mum and more about providing peace of mind for members of my family that were n't able to speak to mum when she passed away .
`` hopefully they can come to terms with the finality of death and understand that mum 's passed away .
`` what 's more important for me is that they can find solace in their own way . ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shadow chancellor john mcdonnell due in luton
text: as the labour leader jeremy corbyn prepares for his first major speech of the election campaign , the shadow chancellor john mcdonnell will later be campaigning in luton , alongside luton north mp kelvin hopkins .

the labour mp for luton south , gavin shuker , has previously been critical of mr corbyn 's leadership and yesterday was asked about how the party would defend the four current seats that labour hold in the east .
`` labour is clearly coming from behind in this election , '' he said .
`` i do n't think people should give theresa may a blank cheque , i think a real opposition is important which is why i think they should return labour mps across the east . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hertford rfc congratulate jamie george on lions ' selection
text: hertford rugby club have tweeted their congratulations to jamie george on his much talked about selection for the british and irish lions .
hooker george started his junior rugby career at hertford before moving to the saracens academy , and was ahead of england captain dylan hartley for this summer 's trip to new zealand .
i expect he 's still smiling as wide this morning as he is in this - back row , third from left .
well deserved @ twitterid @ twitterid 's 1st british and irish lion @ twitterid is today 's smile as big as the one in this photo ?
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail services return to london euston following fire
text: commuters have been told to expect a near normal service to and from london euston this morning , after engineers worked through the night following yesterday 's major disruption .
services were affected following a fire next to the track near south hampstead which damaged signalling and cut power .

virgin trains says it expects a full service , although there could be some delays , while london midland says some trains may be shorter than normal as many carriages were trapped in sidings overnight .
customers are advised to check before they travel .
# vtinfo a full service is expected to run today following yesterdays disruption in london .

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live updates from beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be here from now until 18:00 bringing you the very latest news , sport , weather and travel .
this morning we 'll start by bringing you the latest news about the travel situation for those wanting to travel into london euston by train after yesterday 's track side fire .
but first , as always , there 'll be a full regional weather forecast .
if you want to get in touch , you can do it by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from all of us here at the local live teams for beds , herts and bucks for today , we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .
you can read our stories from the day by scrolling down through the feed .
we 're set for a sunny early evening as this great by a bbc weather watcher in biggleswade shows .

documents.title: tyson the one eyed dog : a happy end to a long tail
text: well the good news that we have all been waiting for is tyson has a new home .
he 's now gone to live in bedford after his new owner spotted recent appeals about him on social media .
as well as having a new home , he 's also got a new name , captain morgan .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tyson the one eyed dog on his hunt for a new home
text: you may remember a heart warming story that we brought you the other week .
tyson is a one-eyed `` pirate dog '' who lost an eye after being attacked by a cat and became the `` longest stay dog '' at the rspca 's blackberry farm animal centre , near aylesbury .
this is his story
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airlander : 'pitching up '
text: here 's clarification about the `` pitching up '' of airlander 10 today in cardington .
there are reports of airlander pitching up on its mast by a small amount today , this is an entirely normal event which we expect to see .

documents.title: airlander : we have lift off ( sort of )
text: the world 's longest airship has once again become airborne .
nearly two weeks ago , a newly repaired airlander 10 was taken out of its hangar one home at cardington airfield so it could begin an outdoors test programme and today she left the ground .
the rear raised slightly and according to the company , hybrid air vehicles , this is normal as it craft occasionally does this during testing .
the airlander 10 , christened the martha gwyn , nosedived on only it 's second test flight last august .
a number of new safety measures were added to the £ 25m aircraft including a pair of `` giant inflatable landing feet '' .

documents.title: euston disruption affecting other london terminals
text: national rail has said the disruption at london euston .
( due to a line side fire causing a power cut ) was also affecting nearby terminals , such as clapham junction to the south west , and milton keynes central in the north west .
customers on virgin trains are advised not to travel south of birmingham .
euston is expected to remain closed until 2000 tonight , with customers encouraged to check the national rail website for the latest information .

documents.title: man dies after suffering 'medical episode ' at the wheel in hemel hempstead
text: a man in his 50s has died after the silver honda car he was driving crashed into a fence in hemel hempstead this morning .
police say it happened at about 05:50 on the service road off boundary way .
police are describing it as a `` tragic incident '' as they believe the man from stevenage suffered a `` medical episode at the wheel '' .
he was taken to watford general hospital , but died later .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : line side fire causes train delays for people using london euston
text: london midland is advising passengers to avoid travelling to and from london euston if possible this evening .
no trains are running due to a line side fire near south hampstead which has damaged signalling equipment .
frances thomas , from london midland , says our `` heart goes out to passengers '' and they are doing all they can to `` get people home '' .
he advises that as euston station is closed , for commuters to use chiltern , great western and east midlands trains instead .
# euston statement @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
are trains manchester to kingsx also cancelled ?
hi adam , there are no trains that run direct between these stations - do you have any more details on this journey please ?
similar route at 17:35
the 1735 would run to euston , then change for kings cross .
i imagine this service will be disrupted .

what do you suggest he does
hi rex , there is a replacement coach service running to luton airport parkway for passengers to london :
thanks does he then get on a train from luton to london ?
correct , there is ticket acceptance on these trains .
@ twitterid may have more info regarding the buses .

hi kevin , all our info & updates on this disruption can be found here :
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid will this be resolved by tomorrow ?
we are not sure if it will be , we 'll post info here when we know :

the tranline ap shows no delays ?
hi thomas , there is still major disruption to/from euston :
any updates ?
hi niki , all our info is here : we are continually updating this as we find out more .
any updates ?
# euston incident is affecting services south from # liverpool and # manchester
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: hertfordshire home searched of man wanted over hackney club acid attack
text: police have searched a home in hertfordshire of the man they want to question about an acid attack at a london nightclub .
they 're looking for 25-year-old arthur collins from broxbourne .
twenty people were injured on monday - when acid was sprayed at the mangle e8 club in dalston .

documents.title: buckingham mp bercow to seek third term as speaker
text: john bercow 's office have confirmed he will seek re-election for a third term as the speaker of the house of commons in his buckingham constituency in the general election on 8 june .
when he became speaker eight years ago , the buckingham mp said he would serve for nine years .
the convention has been for major political parties not to field a candidate against the speaker .
we wait to see if this will be the case again .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : mps back snap general election
text: in total 522 voted for a uk general election to be held on 8 june .
here 's the moment buckingham mp and speaker of the house of commons made the announcement .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: firefighter 'father figure ' retires after 40 years on call
text: an on-call firefighter , referred to by colleagues as `` dad '' , has retired after 40 years ' service .
roy nicholas joined the fire service at the age of 25 and has been on 24-hour on-call cover at gamlingay station ever since .
he says it 's been a difficult decision to stand down and describes himself as `` the oldest person there - and the youngest '' - because of his sense of humour .
`` i have a lot of friends at the station , i have seen a lot of people come and go and a lot of the youngsters call me dad , '' he said .

`` i am the sort of person who ca n't sit about the whole time doing nothing and i just felt having the fire service has kept me going and on top of that i have really enjoyed helping people in distress . ''
on-call firefighters are n't based at the stations but carry a pager and respond when fire emergencies happen .
they have other full-time jobs and earn an annual fire service wage for their evening , weekend and holiday commitments .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jump to it : and they did it !
text: good news - it all ended happily ever after .
i witnessed nathan jones and mark warne jumping 13,000 feet ( 4,000m ) out of plane to raise thousands of pounds for the luton charity level trust .
mark warne paid £ 750 for the privilege and so far the hatters gaffer has raised about £ 1,670 .
they certainly seem happy to back on solid ground .
luton manager nathan jones and fan mark have just arrived back safely .
here 's what they had to say about jumping out of a plane for charity
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: jump to it : and they 're off
text: this is the moment that hatter 's manager nathan jones prepared to jump out of a plane , with life long luton town football club fan , mark warne .
and they 're off .
away they go !
@ twitterid # coyh

but for the rest of the day will be fine and dry day with plenty of sunshine to enjoy and with winds staying light throughout .

documents.title: hunt on for easter egg thieves
text: more than 70 easter eggs were stolen from a store in bushey heath on 11 april , hertfordshire police have revealed .
a pallet of the chocolate was taken from the tesco express petrol station on the high road .
officers want to speak with two women captured on cctv as part of their inquiries .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: jump to it : hatter 's manager prepares to scale new heights
text: so how would you feel if you 're just about to jump 13,000 feet ( 4,000m ) all in the aid of charity ?
here 's what the gaffer and mark warne had to say before their skydive in aid of @ twitterid # coyh

documents.title: jump to it : football manager set for charity skydive
text: let 's hope the luton town football club manager has a head for heights as he 's set to jump out of a plane , all in the aid of charity .
nathan jones will skydive at hinton airfield in northamptonshire at about 13:00 this afternoon .
he 'll have a bit of moral support as he 's doing it with hatters fan , mark warne .
he 's hoping to raise £ 5,000 for the level trust .
the club 's charity of the year it helps young people in the area who live below the poverty line .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire destroys house in shilington
text: a empty house has been destroyed by fire in shillington .
an investigation has started after bedfordshire fire and rescue sent crews from kempston , luton and stopsely to the detached house on bury road at about 15:00 yesterday .
the service says they had to work hard and fast to stop the fire spreading to nearby properties and also deal with asbestos material on one side of the roof .

station commander robbie robinson said : `` the building was within six feet of another property and the wind was pushing the fire in that direction , so it was important we stop the fire spreading further .
`` firefighters used fire jets externally to knock back the fire and protect the neighbouring building which had been evacuated . ''
no one was injured and the fire was put out at 16:30 .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: arrest after 'side of road ' rape
text: arrest after 'side of road ' rape

documents.title: straw ban 'a bit daft '
text: i 've been out in tring this morning trying to get reactions from local people after the hertfordshire-based oakman inns took the decision to stop serving drinks with plastic straws .
they company says they are planning on offering an eco-friendly alternative , as a way of saving helping the environment .
the decision has n't gone down that well with many people i spoke with - one man said he would `` walk out '' if he could n't get one .
some thought it was a `` bit daft '' but `` alternatives must be offered '' , some thought it was `` pretty poor , as i ca n't see why it would make any difference to the environment '' .
only one person i spoke to thought it was a good idea and said `` the environment must come first '' .
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: david bowie statue to be delayed
text: david bowie statue to be delayed

documents.title: herts-based restaurant chain to ban straws
text: a tring-based restaurant chain is to stop serving drinks with plastic straws to help the environment .
oakman inns currently uses more than 100,000 plastic straws a month across its 17 venues .
the company is launching its ban the straw campaign on saturday 's earth day declaring `` we believe straws suck '' .
chief executive peter borg-neal said : `` it sounds ridiculous , but it is entirely accurate to say , that every plastic straw that was ever made , still exists today .

`` they pollute landfills , rivers , roadsides , sewers , beaches and of course oceans and this relatively small amount that this pub group is taking out of circulation , needs to be repeated by every one of my colleagues across the hospitality industry . ''
if customers want a straw they will be offered an eco-friendly alternative .
tom tanner from the sustainable restaurant association said : `` i really would n't say that straws are an essential item in life and i 'd challenge anybody who said they were .
`` by taking this step they are going to be preventing over a million straws a year going into landfill or even finding their way into our oceans . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hackney club acid attack : police hunt for herts man arthur collins
text: police have named a man from hertfordshire they want to speak to in connection with an acid attack at a nightclub in east london .
arthur collins , 25 , from broxbourne , is believed to be the boyfriend of the reality tv star , fearne mccann .
the incident saw 20 people suffer burns inside mangle e8 in the early hours of monday .
officers believe a dispute between two groups of people resulted in a noxious substance being sprayed directly at two people and hitting others .
a witness said the attack left two men `` unable to see '' .
police do not believe the attack was gang related .
no arrests have been made .
ms mccann , who is known for her appearances on the only way is essex and i 'm a celebrity get me out of here , has urged him to go to a police station immediately .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east region gears up for snap general election
text: the region has been put on an election footing for what will be known as the `` brexit election '' .
theresa may made the surprise announcement this morning because opposition parties are undermining her team negotiating the best deal for the uk after leaving the european union .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: blind man helped to see again by 'artificial intelligence glasses '
text: a blind man from dunstable has been helped to see using `` artificial intelligence glasses '' .
the orcam glasses have a tiny smart camera that can recognise text and even people 's faces .
the glasses then speak to the person wearing them through a pair of headphones and explain exactly what they are looking at .
mark bilton was born deaf and at the age of 19 he was diagnosed with retinitis pigmentosa , an inherited eye condition which affects the retina .
from then his sight deteriorated and back in 2002 he was registered blind .
mr bilton says the glasses have made a massive difference to his life .
he said : `` i 'm able to read things that previously i was unable to .
`` i could n't read things off paper , but with these glasses i can have it read to me and it up in my hearing aids . ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: general election : how the east will battle it out
text: this election will be the brexit election .
with most of the east of england voting to leave and already solidly conservative , there are unlikely to be many surprises - but a few seats will be fiercely fought over .
top of the list will be cambridge where 74 % of people voted to remain in the eu and norwich south ( 59 % ) .
both seats used to be held by the liberal democrats who will see this election as a second referendum .
both seats now have labour mps who were in the remain camp , but with the official labour party policy being to support article 50 , both daniel zeichner and clive lewis will have to fight hard .
north norfolk will be another interesting one .
lib dem health spokesman norman lamb has always been able to command a strong personal vote , but 59 % of people in north norfolk voted to leave and mr lamb only has a majority of 4,000 .
clacton 's one to watch
it 's mp douglas carswell left ukip last month and said he 'd stand as an independent .
that could be a challenge in itself , but he 'll also have to face businessman aaron banks , a big ukip donor who has declared that he will stand against carswell .
the conservative association in chelmsford will have to find a new candidate as sir simon burns has already announced that he would stand down at the next election .
and will sir alan haselhurst stand again in saffron walden ?
last time some in his local party tried to deselect him because they thought he was too old .
hitchin and harpenden is a seat which we do n't normally pay much attention to , but it 's held by arch euro sceptic peter lilley and in north hertforshire there was a strong remain vote last year .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: haddenham fire : two boys arrested
text: two 15-year-old boys have been arrested on sus of setting bales of hay on fire in the village of haddenham near aylesbury .
station road was closed because of the bales of hay on fire at manor farm .
one boy from aylesbury and another from thame have been released while investigations continue .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

text: it 's a rather glorious day out there and our bbc weather watchers have been out and about taking some lovely photos for us .

documents.title: baroness sal brinton : lib dems 'real opposition ' to conservative
text: the president of the liberal democrats has said the calling of a snap general election has prompted 1,000 people to join the party .
speaking about the surge in membership watford 's baroness sal brinton said : `` this proves that the liberal democrats are seen as the real opposition to this conservative brexit government .
`` this is a time when liberals must stand together , and people across the country are doing just that . ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pedestrian airlifted to hospital following collision with car
text: a teenage boy has been airlifted to hospital following a collision with a car in watford this morning .
the east of england ambulance service received a call at 09:06 to a report of a collision between a car and pedestrian in st albans road .
a black vauxhall corsa was travelling along the st albans road towards rickmansworth .
as it approached the underpass which goes under the town hall roundabout near to the palmers fiat garage , it collided with a pedestrian .
the 16-year-old suffered a serious head injury and received some treatment at the scene before being airlifted to royal london hospital in what was described as a life-threatening condition .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: easyjet forced couple off overbooked flight
text: easyjet has apologised after two passengers were removed from an overbooked flight without being offered compensation or an alternative flight .
the british couple were due to fly from luton airport to catania in sicily .
after boarding the aircraft they were asked to leave by staff because the plane had been overbooked .
the two passengers , who had booked non-refundable accommodation in italy , were told that the next available easyjet flight was four days later .
the luton-based airline failed to tell them they were entitled to a flight the same day with another airline , or to compensation as stipulated under eu rules .
the incident happened a day after a united airlines passenger was dragged off a plane in the us .
easyjet said it was `` genuinely sorry '' for what had happened and blamed human error for the situation .

documents.title: 'trauma teddies ' handed out by fire crew
text: high wycombe fire station has tweeted about its new `` trauma teddies '' .
the cuddly toys are handed out to children who have been involved in traumatic incidents , such as car accidents or house fires .
we 've contacted buckinghamshire fire and rescue service to find out if anyone was injured in the accident .
green watch used our new # traumateddies to comfort the 3 young children involved in this collision earlier today @ twitterid @ twitterid
great to know the trauma teddies are helping
@ twitterid
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: developer to sponsor festival after gas cut
text: the company which accidentally cut the gas to thousands of homes in ampthill last year is to sponsor the town 's annual festival .
last november , bloor homes accidentally cut through a gas main , leaving 6,000 homes without gas for several days .
it 's been announced that this summer the company is sponsoring ampthill festival 's gala day on sunday , 2 july .
it 's free to attend with various entertainment and activities taking place throughout the day .
one of the festival organisers , christine smith , said : `` the festival is a massive event for us .
the whole community has come on board .
`` bloor homes said they wanted to support the event this year .
`` it 's something they often do .
every time they build a new development , they support local led initiatives in the area . ''

documents.title: road closed following blaze
text: firefighters have been tackling a large fire in a field at station road in haddenham near aylesbury .
around 120 bales of miscanthus , a type of grass , caught fire at about 15:30 yesterday .
thames valley police say the road is likely to remain closed until this afternoon .
the first of this evening 's relief crews is now at the fire involving about 120 bales of miscanthus , aka elephant grass , at haddenham
we waved as we flew over just now .
looks like it 'll be going for a while !
hope you have a kettle # p6572
is it still burning ?

BBC Three Counties Radio

but you 'll still have the chilly north-easterly breeze .

documents.title: team newswatford v swansea ( 15:00 bst )
text: the big news for watford is captain troy deeney makes a return to the starting line-up in one of three changes for the home side .
sebastian prodl has recovered from a rib injury , while etienne capoue also comes in replacing craig cathcart ( knee ) , isaac success and stefano okaka .
watford : gomes , janmaat , prodl , mariappa , holebas , cleverley , doucoure , capoue , amrabat , deeney , niang .
subs : pantilimon , kabasele , mason , behrami , d pereira , success , okaka .
fernando llorente returns to swansea 's starting xi after coming off the bench against west ham following two games out with an ankle problem .
but jack cork misses out with an ankle injury and is replaced by jay fulton .
swansea : fabianski , naughton , fernandez , mawson , olsson , fulton , fer , ki , narsingh , llorente , sigurdsson .
subs : kingsley , baston , carroll , nordfeldt , van der hoorn , ayew , routledge .

documents.title: crunch time for swanswatford v swansea ( 15:00 bst )
text: this is a far bigger game for swansea .
watford can consider themselves almost safe and look forward to another season in the premier league .
for swansea , the situation is grim .
their honeymoon period under paul clement has subsided after an initial bounce .
they have n't won in five games and i saw nothing in their defeat at west ham last weekend which suggested they can turn it around .
author: John Motson
Match of the Day commentator
